samples.question: [Transcript chunk 5]

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 15]
samples.transcript: The best decision they could have made yes it kind of reminds me of like when you are growing up and your parents are always asking you to play a musical instrument and at the time you never want to and then when you grow older you are so happy that you can play the piano or the violin well yes exactly and do you speak any other languages i do i speak japanese and korean right and I am trying to learn chinese now right so can you tell us a bit about learning japanese I have actually been in japan for four years before i came back to my country and i went there for my university so i studied design and all my classes were conducted in japanese right okay so you must have already had a good level of japanese to get into the university in the first place i i actually really enjoyed learning japanese back in middle school so i took like japanese class outside school like cram school every saturday like two hours a week and after that i had like an intense course of like eight months course for japanese before before i entered university and around like four months in japan learning the japanese language wow and did you feel that in that time you got to a high enough level of japanese that you could study well in the university at first not really because i actually plan to be in japan for a year before i enter university but when i during the interview for like different classes we had to like take a test to see what class we were in and during that test we had like an interview as well and back then.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 16]
samples.transcript: Somehow like the professors there told me like do you want to be in university next term and i was like i can or like is my level all right already and they told me yes so i just like went for it wow wow so you actually went a year early you plan to give yourself one more year of studying and then in the interview they said hey your japanese is great let us start yes exactly wow i still did not really believe my ears back then because i was like i i just came to japan and like you know I am ready for like a year of learning and then suddenly they were like you just you can just go and study right away but it was quite challenging in fact like the classes like my first year of university was quite challenging or more of like the first term first semester of the year was difficult because i could not really adjust to the environment like all my classmates are japanese except like two people who are like foreigners so like it was kind of challenging to be in like a real japanese environment with like real friends and classmates and like the teacher teaching everything in japanese the level was very different from when i studied the language so i had like quite a hard time back then yeah do you do you think in hindsight you would have preferred to have an extra year to to prepare actually i would say no because i i feel that i can still like i got a lot from from university itself so even if i did not study the language that well or did not have another year but in class we would still have to use it frequently so.

samples.transcript: To be honest, I cannot imagine my life without computer because most of the time I use google.com for preparing notes myself. I would not able to access information without computer. So I cannot imagine my life without computer. >> Okay, great. Okay.
